content.question: Which of the following took place after presidential candidates Truman in 1948, Nixon in 1968, and Clinton in 1992 won only pluralities of the popular vote?

choices.label: The election was formally decided in the House of Representatives.
The election was formally decided in the Senate.
The winning candidate took office after receiving less than 50% of the popular votes cast.
The electoral college votes cast by independents were critical in determining the winner.
The results of the popular vote necessitated a runoff.

content.answer: The winning candidate took office after receiving less than 50% of the popular votes cast.
